# currentEvent

**Instance Property**

The event currently being processed by the application.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var currentEvent: NSEvent? { get }
```

## Discussion

The value of this property is given by calling by invoking the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSApplication] method [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSApplication/currentEvent].

## Handling Events

- **nextEvent(matching:)**: Returns the next event matching a given mask.
- **nextEvent(matching:until:inMode:dequeue:)**: Forwards the message to the global application object.
- **discardEvents(matching:before:)**: Forwards the message to the global application object.
- **postEvent(_:atStart:)**: Forwards the message to the global application object.
- **sendEvent(_:)**: This action method dispatches mouse and keyboard events the global application object sends to the window.
- **tryToPerform(_:with:)**: Dispatches action messages with a given argument.
